SlideShow.Title: Slide show: Guide to beans and legumes
SlideShow.Abstract: Want to add variety to your diet? Experiment with beans and legumes.

Slide.Caption:
Beans, peas and lentils are all legumes and are among the most versatile and nutritious foods available. Legumes are typically low in fat, and high in fiber, folate, potassium, iron and magnesium. Beans and other legumes can be a healthy substitute for meat, which has more fat and cholesterol.

If you're looking to add more beans and other legumes to your diet, this visual guide can help get you started.

By the way, these are adzuki beans. Also known as azuki beans, field peas or red oriental beans, they're common in Japanese and Chinese cuisines.
Slide.Title: Can you name that bean?

Slide.Caption: Also known as Jacob's cattle beans. Commonly used in soups and Southwestern dishes. They can also be used in recipes that call for pinto beans.
Slide.Title: Anasazi beans

Slide.Caption: Also known as turtle beans. Commonly used in soups, stews, rice dishes and in Latin American cuisines.
Slide.Title: Black beans

Slide.Caption: Also known as cowpeas. Commonly used in salads, casseroles, fritters and Southern dishes.
Slide.Title: Black-eyed peas

Slide.Caption: Also known as garbanzos or ceci beans. Commonly used in casseroles, hummus, minestrone soup, Spanish and Indian dishes.
Slide.Title: Chickpeas

Slide.Caption: Also known as green soybeans. Commonly used as a snack or appetizer, and in salads, casseroles and rice dishes.
Slide.Title: Edamame

Slide.Caption: Also known as broad beans, faba beans or horse beans. Commonly used in stews and side dishes.
Slide.Title: Fava beans

Slide.Caption: Commonly used in stews, salads, chilies and rice dishes.
Slide.Title: Kidney beans

Slide.Caption: Commonly used in soups, stews, salads, side dishes and Indian dishes.
Slide.Title: Lentils

Slide.Caption: Also known as butter beans or Madagascar beans. Commonly used in succotash, casseroles, soups and salads.
Slide.Title: Lima beans

Slide.Caption: Also known as soybean seeds, roasted soybeans or soya beans. Commonly eaten as a snack or used to garnish salads.
Slide.Title: Soy nuts
